name: Bender's Quiz
description: An expandable and customizable quiz app with a fun theme courtesey of everyone's favorite lazy robot, Bender. It features animations and a leaderboard that makes use of Local Storage to keep scores between games. Questions and answers are kept in an Object making it easy to change the content to your needs, but by default asks questions on Javascript basics

name: Tech Blog
description: This is a full stack blog website that supports multiple users. Users can view comment on other user's posts. The dashboard allows for content creation and deletion. It incorperates a retro Tron-like design using perspective and css instead of static assets. Sequelise is used to interact with a mySQL database to store content and user data and Handlebars is used to render the content. This project is deployed on Heroku, so 20 seconds might be required for the dyno to wake up.

name: Story Factory
description: A writing game with a time attack game that lets you build stories with friends or strangers. This was the final project in my coding boot camp and was a collaberation with 2 other talented developers. This project is deployed on Heroku, so 20 seconds might be required for the dyno to wake up.

name: Workplace Tracker
description: This is an app for keeping track of Employees, Job Titles, Departments, and Salaries at your business. It uses an elegant command line interface using node.js and inquirer. Data is stored using a mySQL database.

name: Weather Widget
description: A simple, yet easy on the eye weather app. With the help of the Open Weather Map API it displays current weather conditions as well as the five day weather forcast. Moment.js is incorperated for time and date functions. Local Storage is used to store recent searches and to refresh your last search each time the app is launched. Lastly, this app utilizes Bootstrap Icons for weather condition graphics.

name: Sound Lane
description: This project was a collaberation between myself and two other people. Sound Lane uses API calls from AudioDB and Last.fm to populate a page with information and images for your favorite musical artists.

name: Tetris
description: This relatively simple Javascript based Tetris app was the product my love for games and my impatience. I build this between the time I signed up for my Bootcamp and the time that classes started. It uses a single canvas element and uses a grid of objects that are manipulated to create the game play.

name: Quizinator
description: This project is a full stack application and a collaberation between myself and two others. It is a quiz sharing app platform letting the user create their own quizzes as well as try their hand at quizzes that others have created. This project is deployed on Heroku, so 20 seconds might be required for the dyno to wake up.

name: Socialite API
description: This is a backend for a social media site called Socialite. It Express.js to serve up data from MongoDB through the Mongoose ODM. REST routes are included for adding Users, Users befriending other users, making posts called "Thoughts", and adding comments called "Reactions"

name: HR helping Hand
description: A tool to help a product manager build an html representing their team using node.js and inquirer. The user is prompted with questions about themself, and their team. An html file is generated with cards for each of your team members.

name: Portfolio-V2
description: This is my second attempt at a portfolio. I realized a few days into this project that maybe the idea I had in my head was a bit too ambitious. I make use of perspective quite a bit in this page.

name: Portfolio-V1
description: Here it is. My first crack at a portfolio. All dynamic elements are implemented using only CSS and is fully mobile responsive.
